{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2011}} {{refimprove|date=March 2009}} A '''parallel import''' is a non-[[counterfeit]] [[good (accounting)|product]] imported from another country without the permission of the [[intellectual property]] owner. Parallel imports are often referred to as [[grey market|grey product]] and are implicated in issues of [[international trade]], and [[intellectual property]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wto.org/english/thewto_e/glossary_e/parallel_imports_e.htm|title=WTO - Glossary - parallel imports|website=www.wto.org|accessdate=6 June 2018}}</ref>
Parallel importing is based on concept of [[exhaustion of intellectual property rights]]: according to this concept, when the product is first launched on the market in a particular jurisdiction, parallel importation is authorized to all residents in the state in question. Some countries allow it but others do not.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inta.org/Advocacy/Pages/ParallelImportsGrayMarket.aspx|title=Parallel Imports/Gray Market|website=www.inta.org|accessdate=6 June 2018}}</ref>
Parallel importing of pharmaceuticals reduces price of pharmaceuticals by introducing competition; [[TRIPS agreement]] in Article 6 states that this practice cannot be challenged under the WTO dispute settlement system and so is effectively a matter of national discretion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wto.org/english/tratop_e/trips_e/factsheet_pharm02_e.htm|title=WTO - Intellectual property (TRIPS) - fact sheet - pharmaceuticals - 2|website=www.wto.org|accessdate=6 June 2018}}</ref>
The practice of parallel importing is often advocated in the case of software, music, printed texts and electronic products, and occurs for several reasons:
# Different versions of a product are produced for sale in different markets: the UK edition of [[Top Gear Magazine]] is officially sold in the UK, and [[Top Gear Australia (magazine)|Top Gear Australia]] is officially sold in Australia. However some unofficial distributors in [[Australia]] also sell the UK edition of Top Gear Magazine. # Companies, either the manufacturer or the distributor, set different [[price points]] for their products in different markets. Parallel importers ordinarily purchase products in one country at a price (P1) which is cheaper than the price at which they are sold in a second country (P2), import the products into the second country, and benefitting from [[arbitrage]], sell the products in that country at a price which is usually between P1 and P2. # Consumers who are able to obtain more competitively priced items and may be able to avoid local sales taxes, are placed on an even footing with consumers who have less access to overseas sales online.<ref>{{cite web|title=Your Question ANswered |url=https://www.alia.org.au/advocacy/copyright/your.ques.answered.html |accessdate=16 November 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130515131714/http://www.alia.org.au/advocacy/copyright/your.ques.answered.html |archivedate=15 May 2013 }}</ref> # Some advocacy groups support parallel importing on the grounds of enhancing the free flow of information.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alia.org.au/advocacy/copyright/your.ques.answered.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-05-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100825182748/http://www.alia.org.au/advocacy/copyright/your.ques.answered.html |archivedate=25 August 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==International approach== Parallel importing is regulated differently in different jurisdictions; there is no consistency in laws dealing with parallel imports between countries. Neither the [[Berne Convention for the Protection of Literary and Artistic Works|Berne Convention]] nor the [[Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property|Paris Convention]] explicitly prohibit parallel importation.
===Australia=== The Australian market is an example of a relatively small consumer market which does not benefit from the economies of scale and competition available in the larger global economies. Australia tends to have lower levels of competition in many industries and oligopolies are common in industries like banking, supermarkets, and mobile telecommunications.
Private Enterprise will use product segmentation strategies to legally maximise profit. This often includes varying the service levels, pricing and product features to improve so called "fit" to the local marketplace. However this segmentation may mean an identical products at often higher prices. This can be termed "Price Discrimination".<ref>{{cite web|title=Winning entry for the Kirby Cup 2012 {{!}} Saving the right to parallel import in a digital world|url=http://www.alrc.gov.au/winning-entry-kirby-cup-2012-saving-right-parallel-import-digital-world |date=22 Nov 2012 |accessdate=16 November 2015}}</ref> With the advent of the Internet, Australian consumers can readily compare prices globally and have been able to identify products exhibiting Price Discrimination, also known as the "[[Australia Tax]]".
In 1991, the Australian Government resolved to remove parallel import restrictions from a range of products except cars. It followed this up with legislation making it legal to source music and software CDs from overseas and import them into Australia. An Australian Productivity Commission report recommended in July 2009 that legislation be extended to legalise the parallel importing of books, with three years' notice for publishers.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Hudson|first1=Andrew|title=Australia: Productivity Commission Recommends Removal Of Parallel Import Protection For Books|url=http://www.mondaq.com/australia/article.asp?articleid=83242|accessdate=16 November 2015}}</ref> The commission also recommended abolishing restrictions on parallel importing of cars.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Charlwood|first1=Sam|title=Cheaper second-hand imported cars a step closer|url=http://www.drive.com.au/motor-news/cheaper-secondhand-imported-cars-a-step-closer-20140214-32prt.html|accessdate=16 November 2015}}</ref>
Federal Court of Australia [http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/cases/cth/FCAFC/2012/130.html decision] shows that parallel imported items with valid trademark are subject to [http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/legis/cth/consol_act/tma1995121/s123.html Section 123 of the Trade Mark Act].
Various Parliament of Australia committees have investigated allegations of Price Discrimination.<ref>{{cite web|title=House of Representatives Committees|url=http://www.aph.gov.au/parliamentary_business/committees/house_of_representatives_committees?url=ic/itpricing/subs.htm|accessdate=16 November 2015}}</ref>
===European Union/European Economic Area=== The [[European Union]] (and [[European Economic Area]]) requires the doctrine of international exhaustion to exist between member states (contracting states) but EU legislation for trade marks, design rights and copyright prohibits its application to goods put on the market outside the EU/EEA.
===Germany=== In [[Germany]], the [[Bundesgerichtshof]] has held that the [[exhaustion of rights|doctrine of international exhaustion]] governs parallel importation, subject to the EU rules above.
===Hong Kong=== In Hong Kong, parallel importation is permitted under both, the [[Trade Mark]] and (amended) [[Copyright]] Ordinance before The Copyright (Amendment) Ordinance 2007 came into force 6 July.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.news.gov.hk/en/category/lawandorder/071212/html/071212en08002.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2007-12-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071214013629/http://www.news.gov.hk/en/category/lawandorder/071212/html/071212en08002.htm |archivedate=14 December 2007 |df=dmy-all }} Seven arrested for copyright infringement</ref>
===Japan=== [[Japan]]'s intellectual property rights law prohibits audiovisual articles marketed for export from being sold domestically, and such sale of "re-imported" CDs are illegal.
===United States=== In the [[United States]], legal precedent has established that parallel importation is legal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://caselaw.findlaw.com/us-supreme-court/523/135.html|title=FindLaw's United States Supreme Court case and opinions.|website=Findlaw|accessdate=6 June 2018}}</ref> In the case of [[Kirtsaeng v. John Wiley & Sons, Inc.]], the US Supreme Court held that the [[first-sale doctrine]] applies to copies of a copyrighted work lawfully made abroad, thus permitting importation and resale of many product categories.
Moreover, Science, State, Justice, and Commerce, and Related Agencies, Appropriations Act of 2006 prohibits future FTAs from categorically disallowing the parallel import of patented products.<ref>Shayerah Ilias, Ian Fergusson, “Intellectual Property Rights and International Trade,” Congressional research Service, February 17, 2011</ref>
==Automobiles== {{mainarticle|Grey import vehicle}}
===United States=== The United States has unique automobile design legislation administered by the [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]]. Certain car makers find the required modifications too expensive. This creates demand for [[grey import vehicles]], where certain models are modified for individual customers to meet these requirements, at a higher expense than if this were done by the original manufacturer on an [[assembly line]]. This procedure interferes with the marketing scheme of the manufacturer, who might plan to import a less powerful car and force consumers to accept it. The Imported Vehicle Safety Compliance Act of 1988 basically ended the gray market by requiring manufacturer certification of U.S.-bound cars.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Robinson|first1=Aaron|title=How To: Win the Car-Importing Game|url=http://blog.caranddriver.com/how-to-win-the-car-importing-game/|accessdate=16 November 2015}}</ref>
==Parallel-imported foodstuffs, etc.== Markets for parallel imports and locally made products sometimes exist alongside each other even though the parallel imports are markedly more expensive. This may be for various reasons, but is mostly observed in foodstuffs and toiletry.
Due to the nature of hotels, travellers often have little information on where to shop except in the immediate vicinity. Grocery shops opened to serve brand-name hotels often feature parallel-imported foodstuffs and toiletry to cater to travellers so that they can easily recognise the product they have been using at home.
Foodstuffs and toiletry made from different plants may vary in quality because different plants may use materials or reagents (such as water used for washing, food additives) from different sources, although they are usually subject to the same standards by internal QC or public health authorities. A person may be allergic to the foodstuff or toiletry made by some plants but not others.
To sum up, the major reasons for such a market are:
* Lack of information * Recognisability * Avoidance of risk due to products by different plants <!--Appreciated if someone could improve clarity-->
==Issues== A manifestation of the philosophical divide between those who support various intellectual property and [[Criticism of intellectual property|those who are critical of it]], is the divide over the legitimacy of parallel importation. Some believe that it benefits consumers by lowering prices and widening the selection and consumption of products available in the [[Market (economics)|market]], while others believe that it discourages intellectual property owners from investing in new and [[innovation|innovative]] products. Some also believe that parallel imports tend to facilitate [[copyright infringement]].
This tension essentially concerns the [[rights]] and [[duty|duties]] of a protected [[monopoly]]. Intellectual property rights allow the holder to sell at a price that is higher than the price one would pay in a [[competition|competitive market]], but by doing so the holder relinquishes sales to those who would be prepared to buy at a price between the monopoly price and the competitive price. The presence of parallel imports in the marketplace prevents the holder from exploiting the monopoly further by [[market segmentation]], i.e. by applying different prices to different consumers.
[[Consumer organisation]]s tend to support parallel importation as it offers consumers more choice and lower prices, provided that consumers retain equivalent legal protection to locally sourced products (e.g. in the form of [[warranty|warranties]] with international effect), and competition is not diminished.
However, such organisations also warn consumers of certain risks in using parallel-imported products. Although the products may have been made to comply with the laws and customs of their place of origin, these products or their use may not comply with those in places where they are used, or some of their functions may be rendered unusable or meaningless (which may needlessly drive up prices). Electronic devices, however, suffer less from this type of risk because newer models support more than one user language.
==Examples==
===Australia=== Importation of [[computer games]] and computer game hardware from [[Asia]] is a common practice for some wholesale and/or retail stockists. Many consumers now take advantage of on-line stores in [[Hong Kong]] and the [[United States]] to purchase computer games at or near half the cost of a retail purchase from the Australian RRP. Often the versions sold by the Asian retailers are manufactured in Australia to begin with. An example is [[Crysis]], which was available from Hong Kong on-line stores for approximately $50 AUD but whose retail cost in Australia was close to $100. Crysis was sold in Asia using identical versions of the game box and disc, right down to including Australian censor ratings on the box.
===Hong Kong=== {{See also|Parallel trading in Hong Kong}} Importation of [[Colgate (toothpaste)|Colgate]] [[toothpaste]] from [[Thailand]] into [[Hong Kong]]. The goods are bought in markets where the price is lower, and sold in markets where the price of the same goods is, for a variety of reasons, higher. Electronic goods like Apple's [[iPad]] are frequently imported in Hong Kong before they're official and resold to South-East Asian early adopters for a premium.
===New Zealand=== The practice exists of luxury [[automobile|car]] dealers in [[New Zealand]] buying [[Mercedes-Benz]] [[vehicle]]s in [[Malaysia]] at a low price, and importing the cars into New Zealand to sell at a price lower than the price offered by Mercedes Benz to New Zealand consumers.{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}} There are also many parallel import dealers of electronics hardware. Parallel importing is allowed in New Zealand and has resulted in a significant lowering of margins on many products. {{Citation needed|date=February 2016}}
===Poland=== There is an opinion, not scientifically proven, but very popular among people in Poland that "Western" washing powders are more effective in cleaning than Polish, because chemistry companies allegedly produce items of higher quality for Western Europe, not as good as for Poland. Because of that, there are companies and online stores importing Western chemistry supplies to Poland (for example from Germany), even if similar brands are available there.<ref>http://www.luna24.pl/produkty/proszki-do-prania,2</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pralinka.pl/Chemia-z-niemiec/niemiecki-proszek-do-prania/|title=Proszki do prania z Niemiec - niemiecka chemia pralinka.pl|first=Trol|last=InterMedia|website=www.pralinka.pl|accessdate=6 June 2018}}</ref>
===Russian Federation=== <!-- according to the rg.ru article, external trade volume is 12 times that of internal trade --> According to [http://bablaw.livejournal.com/ Anatoliy Semyonov], trademark rights exhaustion turned national in 2002, and, as of April 2013, an act is being prepared that could make original goods imported without a permission of the producer officially "counterfeit" (by replacing things on which "a trademark is located illegally" with things "on which an illegally used trademark is located"). He notes that, according to the [[Criminal Code of Russia|Criminal Code]], illegal use of a trademark can be punished up to 6 years of imprisonment; and a similar article in the [[Offences Code of Russia|Offences Code]] makes goods with an illegal copy of a trademark subject to confiscation.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://rapsinews.ru/legislation_publication/20130402/266899025.html |title = Параллельный импорт: бизнес-омбудсмены выступили против корпораций |publisher = RAPSI ([[RIA Novosti]]) |date = 2 Apr 2013 |accessdate = 10 Apr 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.rg.ru/2013/04/09/tovari.html |author = Irina Fursova |title = Импорту параллельно |publisher = [[Rossiyskaya Gazeta]] |date = 9 Apr 2013 |accessdate = 10 Apr 2013 }}</ref>
===European Union=== Some [[PlayStation Portable|Sony PSP]] video game consoles were imported into the [[European Economic Area]] from Japan up to twelve months prior to the European launch. The unusual component of this example is that some importers were selling the console for a higher price than the intended EU price, taking advantage of the relative monopoly they enjoyed. After the release the console was commonly imported from the USA where it was retailed for much lower price.
Other example are smart phones, which are being imported from China, where an average device can be bought for about $100 while a similar device would be retailed for about 200€ in the EU.
==See also== * [[Counterfeit consumer goods]] * [[Exhaustion of rights]] * [[Grey market]] * [[Import scene]] * [[Importation right]] * [[Parallel importing in video games]] * [[Track and trace]]
==Bibliography== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080516005011/http://www.thegrayblog.com/ The Gray Blog] is a blog dedicated to parallel market legal issues. * [https://web.archive.org/web/20100825182748/http://www.alia.org.au/advocacy/copyright/your.ques.answered.html Australian Library and Information Association - Statement on Parallel Importing] [https://www.dutchparalleltrading.com/ Statement on Parallel import and export, or parallel trade * [https://web.archive.org/web/20100123091847/http://www.pc.gov.au/projects/study/books/report Australian Productivity Commission 2009: "Restrictions on the Parallel Importation of Books"] - The Australian Productivity Commission report, released 14 July 2009, presented original research to advocate the removal of parallel import restrictions on books. * {{cite web |url = https://lwn.net/Articles/543616/ |title = Upholding the first sale doctrine
==References== <references />
{{Trademark law}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Parallel Import}} [[Category:Intellectual property law]] [[Category:Import]]

'''Richard Karl Wilhelm Bruhn''' (25 June 1886 Cismar, now administratively part of [[Grömitz]] – 8 July 1964 [[Düsseldorf]]) was a German automobile manufacturer and entrepreneur.<ref>[http://www.cismar.de/audi.htm www.cismar.de]</ref>
==Parentage== Bruhn was the son of a shoe maker called Heinrich Christian Emil Bruhn and his wife Karoline Ernestine Bruhn (born Glüsing).
==Early career== On leaving his elementary school Bruhn undertook an apprenticeship as an electrician before switching to a career in Business. In 1907 he took a clerical position in the engineering section of [[AEG]] in [[Bremen]].
In 1910 Bruhn took charge of AEG’s [[London]] commercial office. He undertook [[First World War|war service]] between 1914 and 1918, and after the war he became a student at the [[University of Kiel]], emerging in 1921 with a doctorate in Economics.
Directly after this Bruhn took a commercial directorship with [[:de: Hagenuk|Neufeldt & Kuhnke]] in [[Kiel]], and in 1927 he joined the board of directors at [[Junkers]] in [[Dessau]]. He moved again in 1929, this time to [[Chemnitz]] where he became a director at [[:de: Hermann Pöge|Pöge Elektricitäts-AG]].
==Bruhn's move into the auto-sector== A move into the automotive sector came in 1930 when a regional bank, the Sächsische Staatsbank, mandated him to join the board of the “Zschopauer Motorenwerke J. S. Rasmussen (DKW)”, a dynamic but structurally convoluted and financially troubled automaker in which the bank was heavily invested. Two years later, as part of a vigorous rationalisation designed to protect the future of the business, the [[Auto Union]] company was created, comprising four automobile brands that the automotive entrepreneur [[Jørgen Skafte Rasmussen]] had acquired and built up over the years. Bruhn himself was installed as Chairman of the new company in 1932, which aligned with the wishes of the company’s bankers but would create tensions with Rasmussen whose vision and energy had built up the businesses in the first place. Two years later, in 1934, it was Jørgen Skafte Rasmussen who resigned from the company. Bruhn stayed till 1945.
On 7 May 1945 Bruhn left [[Chemnitz]], along with many of his fellow citizens. Although the area had been liberated by the [[American army]], it had already been agreed between the victor powers under the [[Potsdam Agreement]] that [[Thuringia|the entire region]] would fall within the [[Soviet Occupation Zone]] and many Germans fled to the western part of Germany at this time. Bruhn, who had been a member of the [[Nazi Party]] during the Hitler years, was interned by [[:de: Control Commission for Germany/British Element|the British]]. He underwent the [[denazification]] process. As an Auto Union director he accepted his share of the responsibility for the employment of [[prisoner of war|prisoners of war]] at the company’s plants during the [[Second World War|war]], but he was nevertheless released, and by the end of 1945 had been able to relocate to [[Ingolstadt]] in Bavaria (which was in the [[:de: Amerikanische Besatzungszone|American occupation zone]]). Auto Union’s small DKW-badged cars had sold well during the 1930s, and were generally too small and slow to have been commandeered by the German military during the war or by the armies of the occupying powers after it. Many pre-war DKWs survived the war and in December 1945 it was possible to create in Ingolsadt the "Central depot for Auto Union replacement parts" (“Zentraldepot für Auto Union Ersatzteile GmbH “). The longer term outlook for any form of German manufacturing industry remained at this stage unclear, and Auto Union’s plant, located in the Soviet zone, was out of reach. But with financing from the [[:de: Bayerische Staatsregierung|Bavarian Regional government]] and [[Marshall Plan]] funding, it was possible to create in September 1949 a new company in [[West Germany]] called [[Auto Union|Auto Union GmbH]], and based at the Ingolstadt parts depot. Richard Buhn was the company’s first boss. At this stage automobile production was established in a rented factory several hundred kilometers to the west, in [[Düsseldorf]], but in due course it would be possible to finance and built a car plant at the new company’s spacious site in Ingolstadt. The first Ingolstadt-produced [[Audi]] car would emerge from the factory, by now owned by the [[Volkswagen]] group, in 1964, the year of Bruhn’s death.
On May 26, 2014, a new investigative report was issued by AUDI that condemned Bruhn for close association with Nazi leaders and extensive use of concentration camp inmates as forced labor. http://www.thelocal.de/20140526/audi-used-forced-labour-under-nazis-in-germany
==Sources== {{reflist}}
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bruhn, Richard Karl Wilhelm}} [[Category:Audi]] [[Category:Commanders Crosses of the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany]] [[Category:1886 births]] [[Category:1964 deaths]] [[Category:German businesspeople]] [[Category:Automotive pioneers]] [[Category:German founders of automobile manufacturers]]

revision.text:
'''Robert Scharfe''' was born on 26 November 1953 and is the Chief Executive Officer of the [[Luxembourg Stock Exchange]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bourse.lu/Page/LuxSE%20elections%20and%20appointments%202012 |title=Bourse de Luxembourg press release |accessdate=2012-11-23 }}</ref> (Bourse de Luxembourg), a post he has held since 18 April 2012.
He is also chairman of the board<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fundsquare.net/company-structure-and-history |title=Fundsquare "Company structure and history" page |accessdate=2014-04-27 }}</ref> of [[Fundsquare]], a wholly owned subsidiary of the Luxembourg Stock Exchange.
In addition, he is a member of the board of directors<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fese.eu/about-us/our-organisation/8-about/174-fese-board-members |title=FESE "FESE Board Members" page |accessdate=2017-12-13 }}</ref> of the [[Federation of European Securities Exchanges]] and the chairman of the nomination committee<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.world-exchanges.org/home/index.php/about/committees |title=WFE "WFE Committees" page |accessdate=2017-12-13 }}</ref> of the [[World Federation of Exchanges]].
==Career== He began his career in 1977 at Banque Générale du Luxembourg (now [[BGL BNP Paribas]]) and up to 2012 held a variety of positions in the bank. These included terms as the head of financial markets from 1985 to 1994, head of private banking from 1994 to 1998 and CEO of the global markets business line from 2004 to 2007. He finished his time at this bank as a member of the management board in charge of corporate and investment banking.
He was a member of the board of directors of the Luxembourg Stock Exchange from April 2001<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.paperjam.lu/article/fr/robert-scharfe-futur-patron-de-la-bourse |title=PaperJam magazine article|accessdate=2012-04-18 }}</ref> and in 2004 was elected vice-chairman, a mandate he held until his appointment as CEO.
He was also chairman of the board<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.finesti.com/contenu/docs/EN/apropos/news/communiques/2012/Finesti_New_Chairperson_19-04-2012.pdf |title=Finesti press release |accessdate=2012-05-02 }}{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> of [[Finesti]], a wholly owned subsidiary of the Luxembourg Stock Exchange, from April 2012 until its integration in July 2013 into Fundsquare.
==Education and Personal== Robert Scharfe holds a master's degree in economics from the [[University of Nancy]], France. He is an alumnus of INSEAD, France and of Stanford Graduate School of Business, Palo Alto, USA. He is married and has three children.
==Footnotes== {{reflist}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2015}} {{Use Australian English|date=June 2015}} {{Infobox person | name = Rodd Partridge | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1976|12|30}} | birth_place = [[Sydney, New South Wales]], [[Australia]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = [[Financier]], [[Retailer]], [[Entrepreneur]] | religion = | spouse = | parents = | children = }}
'''Rodd Partridge''' (born 30 December 1976) is an Australian born retailer and private investor.
Partridge is regarded as intensely private and somewhat reclusive, his only recent media interview was with Spanish newspaper Cinco Dias<ref>[http://www.cincodias.com/articulo/empresas/grupo-britanico-Partridge-compra-almacenes-Sepu/20011112cdscdiemp_12/ El grupo británico Partridge compra los almacenes Sepu en Cincodias.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> after his group's acquisition of the retailing group [[SEPU]]. Partridge currently heads [[Invicta Partners]], a [[private equity]] firm based in [[Sydney]], [[Australia]], and he is understood to hold a number of investments throughout the Pacific and South America. Partridge closed the Spanish retail operations in 2002, facing intensive protests from employees and extensive media coverage.<ref>[http://www.elpais.com/articulo/madrid/paraiso/gangas/Gran/Via/echa/cierre/elpepiautmad/20021001elpmad_14/Tes El paraíso de las gangas de la Gran Vía echa el cierre · ELPAÍS.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.elpais.com/articulo/madrid/Sepu/cerrado/elpepiautmad/20021013elpmad_3/Tes Sepu, cerrado · ELPAÍS.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.gettyimages.com.au/detail/91919294/Hulton-Archive Getty Images - Unsupported browser detected<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
== Personal == Partridge is known to fence, surf and be a strong supporter of the [[Rugby Union]] code. One of Partridge's quirks is that although his enterprises often retail alcohol, Partridge himself is, by personal choice, a strict [[Teetotalism|teetotaler]]. Originally a military and pastoral family, it is understood Partridge's ancestors arrived in Australia from the United Kingdom in 1814.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://colsec.records.nsw.gov.au/indexes/colsec/p/f43c_pa-12.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-03-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110312095449/http://colsec.records.nsw.gov.au/indexes/colsec/p/F43c_pa-12.htm |archivedate=12 March 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>[http://www.hastings.nsw.gov.au/www/html/946-local-studies.asp]</ref>
Partridge holds a Master of Business from the [[University of Newcastle, Australia]].
== References == <!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Partridge, Rodd}} [[Category:Businesspeople in retailing]] [[Category:Australian mass media owners]] [[Category:Spanish businesspeople]] [[Category:1976 births]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{Other people|Curt Johnson}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2016}} {{Infobox person | image = | image_size = | name = S. Curtis Johnson | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = American | religion = | ethnicity = | residence = [[Racine, Wisconsin]], United States | education = | alma mater = [[Cornell University]]
[[Kellogg School of Management]] | occupation = former chairman of the [[Diversey, Inc.]] | known for = | salary = | networth = [[United States dollar|$]]3.5 billion (Feb 2016){{cite web|title=S. Curtis Johnson|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/s-curtis-johnson/|website=Forbes|accessdate=February 9, 2016}} | spouse = | parents = [[Samuel Curtis Johnson, Jr.]]
[[Imogene Powers Johnson]] | children = 4 | relatives = [[Herbert Fisk Johnson III]]
[[Helen Johnson-Leipold]]
[[Winnie Johnson-Marquart]] (siblings) | website = }} '''S. Curtis "Curt" Johnson''' is the son of [[Samuel Curtis Johnson, Jr.]], who died in 2004, and [[Imogene Powers Johnson]], and the great great grandson of [[S. C. Johnson & Son]] founder [[Samuel Curtis Johnson, Sr.]]. The 2013 [[Forbes 400]] list of richest persons in the world placed him at 166 with a net worth of $3 billion.{{cite web|author= |url=https://www.forbes.com/forbes-400/list/#page:2_sort:0_direction:asc_search:_filter:All%20industries_filter:All%20states_filter:All%20categories |title=The Richest People in America List |publisher=Forbes |date=January 1, 1970 |accessdate=December 25, 2015}}[http://caledonia.patch.com/articles/curt-johnson-charged-with-sexual-assault?ncid=breaking_news ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110813020645/http://caledonia.patch.com/articles/curt-johnson-charged-with-sexual-assault?ncid=breaking_news |date=August 13, 2011 }} ==Career== Johnson was chairman of [[Diversey, Inc.|Diversey]] until he resigned his position in early 2011, citing personal reasons.{{cite web|url=http://mountpleasant.patch.com/articles/attorney-general-asks-supreme-court-to-review-appellate-decision-in-curt-johnson-case |accessdate=June 9, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121222150751/http://mountpleasant.patch.com/articles/attorney-general-asks-supreme-court-to-review-appellate-decision-in-curt-johnson-case |archivedate=December 22, 2012 }} His sister [[Helen Johnson-Leipold]] succeeded him at the firm. ==Criminal conviction== In March 2011, Johnson was charged in [[Racine County]] Circuit Court with sexually assaulting his step-daughter over a period of three years, starting from when she was 12 years old.{{cite web|last=Johnson |first=Mike |url=http://www.jsonline.com/news/crime/118595529.html |title=Johnson heir charged with sex assault of child |website=Jsonline.com |date=March 24, 2011 |accessdate=December 25, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Business/billionaire-heir-sc-johnson-fortune-accused-molesting-stepdaughter/story?id=13223059 |title=Billionaire Heir to SC Johnson Fortune Accused of Molesting Stepdaughter - ABC News |website=Abcnews.go.com |date=March 25, 2011 |accessdate=December 25, 2015}} In June 2014, he pleaded guilty to two misdemeanors. The victim had moved to North Carolina and wanted the case dismissed and fought efforts to make her appear and testify. Johnson was sentenced to four months in jail with [[work release|Huber privileges]] after 60 days and fined $6,000. He will not have to register as a sex offender.{{cite web|url=http://www.jsonline.com/news/crime/johnson07-b99285933z1-262145461.html|title=Billionaire Johnson heir gets brief jail term in sex assault case|author=Bruce Vielmetti |publisher=Journal Sentinel|date=June 6, 2014|accessdate=June 7, 2014}}{{cite web|author= |url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/s-curtis-johnson |title=S. Curtis Johnson |publisher=Forbes |date=January 1, 1970 |accessdate=December 25, 2015}} ==Political donations== Curtis Johnson gave the Republican National Committee (RNC) $15,000 on June 2009. In 2008, he donated $1,000 to the RNC. He gave a total of $2,000 to Representative [[Paul Ryan]], in four separate donations. {{cite web|url=http://www.rollcall.com/news/republican_donor_samuel_johnson_charged_with_sexual_assault_of_child-204465-1.html |title=Republican Donor Samuel Johnson Charged With Sexual Assault of Child : Roll Call Politics |website=Rollcall.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=December 25, 2015}} The S.C. Johnson and Sons political action committee (PAC) donated $99,700 in 2010 alone. In 2008 it donated $94,125 and similar amounts in previous years. {{cite web|url=http://www.opensecrets.org/pacs/lookup2.php?strID=C00342246&cycle=2010 |title=SC Johnson & Son Summary |website=OpenSecrets.org |date= |accessdate=December 25, 2015}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{S. C. Johnson family}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Johnson, S. Curtis}} [[Category:American billionaires]] [[Category:American manufacturing businesspeople]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Racine, Wisconsin]] [[Category:Cornell University alumni]] [[Category:Samuel Curtis Johnson family]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Wisconsin Republicans]] [[Category:Kellogg School of Management alumni]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox writer | image = simon sinek.jpg | imagesize = 225px | name = Simon Sinek | pseudonym = | caption = Sinek, TEDx Maastricht 2011 | birth_name = Simon Oliver Sinek | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1973|10|09}} | birth_place = [[Wimbledon, London]], England | occupation = Author, [[motivational speaker]] | education = | alma_mater = City, University of London
Brandeis University | notableworks = ''[[Start With Why]]: How Great Leaders Inspire Everyone to Take Action'' | years_active = | website = {{URL|https://www.linkedin.com/in/simonsinek}} }} '''Simon Oliver Sinek''' (born October 9, 1973){{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=gP0Fzj%2Fswk0Ugg9RqxkPXQ&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=19 July 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} is a [[British-American]] author, [[motivational speaker]] and organisational consultant. He is the author of five books, including ''[[Start With Why]]'' (2009).{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/jeffkauflin/2017/06/20/the-years-5-bestselling-leadership-books-and-why-theyre-so-great/#257bb5043ac0|title=The Year's Five Bestselling Leadership Books, And Why They're So Great|last=Kauflin|first=Jeff|date=|work=Forbes|access-date=January 6, 2018|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}} ==Early life and education== Sinek was born in [[Wimbledon, London]], [[United Kingdom]] and as a child lived in [[Johannesburg]], [[South Africa]], [[London]], and [[Hong Kong]] before settling in the [[United States]]. He graduated from [[Northern Valley Regional High School at Demarest]] in 1991.[http://www.nvnet.org/?plugin=RWD&Templates=RWD&object=/superintendents_blog/I074E94AE&infobar=no International Inspirational Speaker and Author Simon Sinek Returns to NVD], [[Northern Valley Regional High School District]]. Accessed February 15, 2013 He studied law at London's [[City, University of London|City University]] and received a BA in [[cultural anthropology]] from [[Brandeis University]].{{cite news|url=http://www.director.co.uk/opinion-simon-sinek-to-grow-your-business-let-go-20674-2/|title=Simon Sinek: To grow your business, let go|last1=Maxwell|first1=Chris|date=Jan 6, 2017|work=Director|accessdate=Jan 14, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|publisher=}} ==Career== Sinek began his career at the New York ad agencies [[Havas Worldwide|Euro RSCG]] and [[Ogilvy & Mather]]. He later launched his own business, Sinek Partners. [[File:Golden circle.png|thumb|Simon Sinek's golden circle which describe a perspective of the influence of successful leaders and organisations.|alt=]] Sinek has written five books. His first book, ''[[Start With Why]]'', was published October 2009. His second book, called ''Leaders Eat Last'', appeared on the best seller lists of the ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'' and ''[[The New York Times]]''. As a [[motivational speaker]], Sinek has given talks at [[United Nations Global Compact|The UN Global Compact]] Leaders Summit,{{Cite web|url=https://www.unglobalcompact.org/take-action/events/leaders-summit/leaders-summit-programme|title=Programme {{!}} UN Global Compact|website=www.unglobalcompact.org|access-date=2018-02-17}}{{third-party inline|date=July 2018}} and at the [[TED (conference)|TED]] conference.{{cite news|last1=Koji|first1=David|title=An Inspiring Discussion With Simon Sinek About Learning Your 'Why'|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/284791|accessdate=2017-01-12|publisher=Entrepreneur|date=2016-12-08}} In June 2018, ''[[The Young Turks]]'' reported a $98,000 no-bid contract from [[U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement]] (ICE) for "customized Simon Sinek leadership training" to take place between April 26 and May 15 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://tytnetwork.com/2018/06/26/ice-paid-famous-motivational-speaker-for-leadership-training/|title=ICE Paid Famous Motivational Speaker for 'Leadership Training'|website=tytnetwork.com|access-date=2018-06-26}} Sinek is also an instructor of Strategic Communications for Master's students at Columbia University{{cite web |title=Instructor Simon Sinek Featured by 99% {{!}} Columbia University School of Professional Studies |url=http://sps.columbia.edu/strategic-communications/news/instructor-simon-sinek-featured-99 |website=sps.columbia.edu |language=en}}, and is an adjunct staff member of the RAND Corporation{{cite web |title=RAND Corporation Staff Directory |url=https://www.rand.org/about/contacts.html |website=RAND Corporation |publisher=RAND Corporation |accessdate=22 August 2018}}. ==Books== *{{cite book|title=Start With Why: How Great Leaders Inspire Everyone to Take Action |last=Sinek |first=Simon|year=2009|isbn=978-1591846444}} *{{cite book|title=Leaders Eat Last: Why Some Teams Pull Together and Others Don't|last=Sinek |first=Simon|year=2014 |isbn=978-1591845324}} *{{cite book|title=Together Is Better: A Little Book of Inspiration|last=Sinek |first=Simon|year=2016|isbn=978-1591847854}}{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/danschawbel/2016/09/13/simon-sinek-why-you-need-other-people-in-order-to-build-a-successful-career|title=Simon Sinek: Why You Need Other People In Order To Build A Successful Career|last1=Schawbel|first1=Dan|date=Sep 13, 2016|work=|accessdate=Jan 12, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|publisher=Forbes}} *{{cite book|title=Find Your Why: A Practical Guide for Discovering Purpose for You and Your Team|last=Sinek|first=Simon|year=2017|isbn= 9781101992982}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.theladders.com/career-advice/millennials-listening-simon-sinek|title=Millennials are telling you why your company stinks but you're not listening: a Q&A with Simon Sinek|last=Burnett|first=Jane|date=August 23, 2017|work=Ladders|access-date=January 6, 2018|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US}} *{{cite book|title=The Infinite Game|last=Sinek|first=Simon|year=2018|isbn= 9780735213500}} * ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Website|https://startwithwhy.com}} *{{Twitter|simonsinek}} *{{YouTube|https://www.youtube.com/user/SimonSinek}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sinek, Simon}} [[Category:American motivational writers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Brandeis University alumni]] [[Category:American non-fiction writers]] [[Category:American motivational speakers]] [[Category:Advertising people]] [[Category:People from Bergen County, New Jersey]] [[Category:RAND Corporation people]] [[Category:British emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:American people of Hungarian-Jewish descent]] [[Category:British people of Hungarian-Jewish descent]]

{{other uses}} {{Infobox settlement | name = São Carlos | settlement_type = [[Municipalities of Brazil|Municipality]] | official_name = The Municipality of São Carlos | image_skyline = São Carlos (montagem).jpg | imagesize = 250px | image_caption = Views of São Carlos, Top left:Night view of São Carlos Cathedral, Top right:Federal University of São Carlos, 2nd:Planes display in Wings of a Dream Museum, P-47D Thunderbolt(left), Santos Dumont Demoiselle(right), Middle:São Carlos Railroad Station, Entrance Building(left), track and platform(right), 4th left:Chamine Garden, 4th right:Alvaro Guiao School, Bottom:Night view of Downtown São Carlos from Iguatemi Shopping Mall | motto = "[[A bandeirantibus venio]]"{{spaces|2}}([[Latin language|Latin]])
"Proceed from bandeirantes" | nickname = The Capital of Technology,
Weather City and Sanca | image_flag = Bandeira SaoCarlos SaoPaulo Brasil.svg | image_shield = Brasão São Carlos.jpg | image_map = SaoPaulo Municip SaoCarlos.svg | mapsize = 250px | map_caption = Location in the São Paulo state. | pushpin_map = Brazil | pushpin_mapsize = 250 | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Brazil | subdivision_type = [[List of sovereign states|Country]] | subdivision_type1 = [[Regions of Brazil|Region]] | subdivision_type2 = [[States of Brazil|State]] | subdivision_name = {{Flag|Brazil}} | subdivision_name1 = [[Southeast Region, Brazil|Southeast]] | subdivision_name2 = {{Flag|São Paulo}} | leader_title = [[Mayor]] | leader_name = Airton Garcia Ferreira ([[Brazilian Socialist Party|PSB]])| | established_title = Founded | established_date = November 4, 1857 | established_title2 = | established_date2 = | established_title3 = [[Municipal corporation|Incorporated]] | established_date3 = 1880 | area_note = | area_magnitude = 1 E9 | area_total_km2 = 1136.907 | area_urban_km2 = 67.25 | population_as_of = 2017/IBGE{{cite web|title=2017 Census of the IBGE - State of SP|url=http://www.ibge.gov.br/home/estatistica/populacao/censo2010/tabelas_pdf/Sao_paulo.pdf|publisher=IBGE.gov.br|accessdate=25 April 2018}} | population_metro = | area_metro_km2 = | population_total = 246,088 | population_density_km2 = 216.45 | timezone = [[UTC-3]] | utc_offset = -3 | timezone_DST = [[UTC-2]] | utc_offset_DST = -2 | coordinates = {{coord|22|01|04|S|47|53|27|W|region:BR|display=inline}} | elevation_m = 856 | elevation_ft = 2,808.4 | website = [http://www.saocarlos.sp.gov.br saocarlos.sp.gov.br - São Carlos' Prefecture] | footnotes = '''[[Human Development Index|HDI]]''' (2000) 0.841 – high }} {{coord|22|01|04|S|47|53|27|W|scale:70000|display=title}} '''São Carlos''' (Saint Charles, in English, {{IPA-pt|sɐ̃w̃ ˈkaʁlus}}; named after [[Charles Borromeo|Saint Charles Borromeo]]) is a city of 246,088 inhabitants ([[Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics|IBGE]]/2017) in the state of [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]], [[Brazil]]. It is located at {{coord|22|01|04|S|47|53|27|W|}}, at about 230 km from the city of [[São Paulo]]. ==History== The region started to be settled in the end of the 18th century, with the opening of a road that led to the gold mines in [[Cuiabá]] and [[Goiás]]. Leaving from [[Piracicaba]], passing through [[Rio Claro, São Paulo|Rio Claro]], the hills, fields and by typical vegetations of the Brazilian countryside, settlers established in the region. São Carlos' history started in 1831, when the "Pinhal" (Pines) allotment was demarcated. On the city's foundation date, November 4, 1857, the population resided in some houses around the chapel and the inhabitants were mostly Arruda Botelho's family heirs, who were the first owners of the "Pinhal" alloments. Between 1831 and 1857 the pioneer coffee farms were formed, starting the first economic activity in the city. The coffee crops came to the "Pinhal" farm in 1840 and spread throughout the fertile lands around, becoming the main export item. The city foundation is credited to [[Antônio Carlos de Arruda Botelho, Count of Pinhal]], an influent farmer and entrepreneur. São Carlos was elevated to [[village]] in 1865, when a "Câmara", or ruling chamber, was created. In 1874, the village had 6,897 inhabitants, as a humble highlight of its fast growth and regional importance. It became a [[city]] in 1880 and in 1886, with a population of 16,104, its urban structure was settled. The city arises on the coffee crops expansion context, which is relevant to the last two decades of the 19th century and to the first two of the 20th century. The arrival of the railway in 1884 provided an efficient system to transport the [[Coffee production in Brazil|coffee production]] to the [[Port of Santos|Santos harbor]] and boosted the economy of the region. The railway also contributed to the political and economic consolidation of the central area of the city. When slavery ended, government created incentives to bring in immigrants. São Carlos had already received German nationals brought by the Count of Pinhal in 1876. Between 1880 and 1904, the city was one of the most important immigration centers in São Paulo state, the majority of them being [[Italian Brazilians|Italians]] - specifically, [[Northern Italy|Northern Italians]]. They worked in coffee plantations and in manufacturing factories, as well as trading activities. In the beginning of the 20th century, countless cultural societies developed social activities aiming to promote literacy. Vittorio Emanuele Society in 1900 and [[Dante Alighieri]] in 1902 were but a few of them. The Italian presence was so significant that during the first half of the 20th century, the Italian government had a consulate branch in São Carlos. With the [[Wall Street crash of 1929]], coffee production went through a crisis, which made many immigrants leave rural areas for factories, wood artifact production, pottery, and construction. Farmers had already applied the profits obtained with coffee in the constitution of several types of companies in São Carlos: banks, electricity, cable cars, telephones, water pumps, sewers, theaters, hospitals and schools. This established a foundation for industrialization in the city. With the arrival of immigrants from other urban centers from the 1930s - 1940s, their expertise was used to consolidate industrialization as the main economic activity in the city. Its peak years were the 1950s, when São Carlos became a manufacturing center, with relevant industrial expression in São Paulo state. The industrial sector also developed through workshops that incorporated the coffee industry. The manufacture of processing machinery, shoes, fertilizers, hardware, furniture, pasta, cigars, as well as activities such as tailory, breweries, foundries, sawmills, weaving, pottery and pencil production expanded the economy of São Carlos in the 1930s. In the 1950s and 1960s, with the expansion of refrigeration, new factories of machinery and tractors arrived. Numerous small- and medium-sized companies which provided products and services were also established. In the second half of the 20th century, the city received a boost of technological and higher educational development when in 1953 the Escola de Engenharia de São Carlos, or the Engineering School of the [[University of São Paulo]], was created. In the 1970s, the [[Federal University of São Carlos]] was launched. ==Geography== São Carlos is located on the geographic center of the São Paulo state, approximately {{convert|231|km|mi|abbr=on}} from the [[São Paulo|city of São Paulo]]. The city is the center of a [[Microregion of São Carlos|microregion]] with 308,777 inhabitants.{{cite web|title=2010 Census of the IBGE - Synopsis - Table 761|url=http://www.sidra.ibge.gov.br/cd/cd2010sp.asp?o=3&i=P|publisher=IBGE.gov.br|accessdate=22 July 2011|language=Portuguese}} Its altitude is over 856 m, offering a mild altitude climate. Most of the year the city is windy, sunny and with mild temperatures at night. For this reason the city is nicknamed "''Cidade do Clima''" (Weather City) and celebrates once a year an event called "''Festa do Clima''", or "Weather Festival". The city has a total area of 1.141 km², which includes two districts to the north (''Santa Eudóxia'' and ''Água Vermelha''), one district to the west (''Bela Vista São-carlense''), and one district to the east (''Vila Nery''). {{wide image|S%C3%A3o_Carlos_-_Downtown_by_Night.jpg|700px|São Carlos Downtown seen from the Iguatemi Shopping Mall (2006 picture).}} ===Climate=== According to the [[Köppen Climate Classification]], the city has an altitude tropical climate with dry winter, with minimum average temperatures of 15,3 °C and maximum of 27,0 °C.

==Economy== The city has an active industrial profile with important national and international industries and certain agricultural importance, backed by technologies developed by [[Embrapa]], owner of two research complexes in the city. Due to its increasing number of high technology industries, the city has been proclaimed "The National Capital of Technology" by Brazilian President [[Dilma Rousseff]] in 2011. The city hosts several locally-grown technology-based companies, such as Opto Eletrônicos, and factories of multinational corporations such as [[Faber Castell]], [[Electrolux]], [[Husqvarna AB|Husqvarna]], [[Tecumseh Products Company|Tecumseh]] and the Brazilian plant of [[Volkswagen]] [[engine]]s, and national corporations such as [[TAM Linhas Aéreas|TAM MRO - Technology Center]], [[Toalhas São Carlos]], [[Tapetes São Carlos]], [[Papel São Carlos]], [[Prominas Brasil]] and [[Latina (industry)|Latina]]. The economic basis of São Carlos is the [[Tertiary sector of the economy|tertiary sector]]. Commerce and services corresponds to 65.9% of the city's GDP. Industry is also relevant. With 32.3% of the economy, the [[Secondary sector of the economy|secondary sector]] has a bigger participation than the state of São Paulo's average. The [[Primary sector of the economy|primary sector]] corresponds to 1.7% of the GDP.{{cite web|title=Municipal Profile at SEADE|url=http://www.seade.gov.br/produtos/perfil/perfilMunEstado.php|publisher=SEADE.gov.br|accessdate=12 July 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110823080724/http://www.seade.gov.br/produtos/perfil/perfilMunEstado.php|archivedate=23 August 2011|df=}} ==Culture== [[File:San Carlos Borromeo Repartiendo Limosna al Pueblo by Jose Salome Pina - 1853.jpg|thumb|250px|''Saint Charles Borromeo Giving Alms to the Poor'', an 1853 painting by [[José Salomé Pina]] — the town of São Carlos is named after the Catholic saint [[Charles Borromeo|Carlos Borromeo]], the [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|cardinal]] [[archbishop of Milan]] from 1564 to 1584.]] São Carlos is home to two [[University of São Paulo|Universidade de São Paulo]] campuses and the [[Federal University of São Carlos|Universidade Federal de São Carlos]] (UFSCar), two of the most important higher learning centers in Brazil. Moreover, another minor and private university, [[Centro Universitário Central Paulista]] (UNICEP), is also based in São Carlos, and community colleges like [[SENAI]], [[Industrial Social Services|SESI]], [[Serviço Social do Comércio|SESC]], [[Serviço Nacional de Aprendizagem Comercial|SENAC]] and the ''Escola Técnica Estadual Paulino Botelho''. This has turned São Carlos into a university-oriented town, with an abundance of student-focused commercial establishments. It is also known for its student parties. São Carlos' cultural life is marked by a young audience that enjoys musical concerts of Brazilian contemporary alternative artists that usually include the city in their tours. Also, São Carlos has 3 theaters and 7 commercial movie-theaters rooms. There are two important events celebrated every year in the city, the ''Climate Party'', which happens in April and has a traditional ''Orchid Exposition'' which features a craftwork fair and several food barracks. An [[Oktobertech]] fest is held yearly along with the [[São Carlos High Tech Fair]] (Fealtec). The [[TAM Airlines]] [[Wings of a Dream Museum]] (''Museu TAM'') was in São Carlos, {{convert|15|km|mi|sp=us}} from central São Carlos."[http://www.museutam.com.br/localizacao.php Visitação e Localização]". TAM Museum. Retrieved on December 15, 2011. "Rodovia SP 318, km249,5 – Água Vermelha São Carlos SP – CEP 13578-000" and "Rod. Eng. Thales de Lorena Peixoto Júnior São Carlos - São Paulo" ==Transportation== ===Roads=== *[[SP-310]] - ''Rodovia'' Washington Luís - 244 km to [[São Paulo]] *[[SP-318]] - ''Rodovia'' Eng. Thales de Lorena Peixoto Junior - 116 km to [[Ribeirão Preto]] *[[SP-215]] - ''Rodovia'' Luís Augusto de Oliveira ===Air=== The city is served by [[São Carlos Airport|Mário Pereira Lopes Airport]], where one of the maintenance bases of [[TAM Airlines]] is located and well as the air and space [[Wings of a Dream Museum|TAM Museum]], owned and maintained by the company. (Closest main airport that operates regular flights is Ribeirao Preto Airport - about 90km away) ==Notable people== Were born in São Carlos: *[[Fábio Aurélio]], [[Liverpool F.C.]] full-back *[[Nenê]], [[Houston Rockets]] player *[[Maurren Maggi]], [[2008 Summer Olympics|2008 Olympics]] gold medallist *[[Ronald Golias]], actor and comedian *[[Thiago Silva (fighter)|Thiago Silva]], [[Ultimate Fighting Championship|UFC]] fighter *[[Izabel Goulart]], model *{{Interlanguage link multi|Sara Winter|pt}}, former [[Radical feminism|radical feminist]] activist ==Twin towns — sister cities== * {{flagicon|Portugal}} [[Coimbra]], [[Portugal]] (since 1970) * {{flagicon|USA}} [[Tecumseh, Michigan|Tecumseh]], [[Michigan]], [[United States]] (since 1997) * {{flagicon|Cuba}} [[Santa Clara, Cuba|Santa Clara]], [[Cuba]] (since 2005) * {{flagicon|Brazil}} [[Santa Cruz, Rio Grande do Norte|Santa Cruz]], [[Rio Grande do Norte]], [[Brazil]] ==See also== {{Portal|Brazil}} * [[University of São Paulo]] - USP * [[Federal University of São Carlos]] - UFSCar * [[Rodovia Washington Luís]] * [[São Carlos Airport]] * [[Grêmio Esportivo Sãocarlense|GE Sãocarlense]] * [[São Carlos Futebol Clube|São Carlos FC]] * [[Estádio Luís Augusto de Oliveira]] * [[São Carlos Clube]] * [[Estádio Paulista]] ==External links== * {{pt icon}} [http://www.saocarlos.sp.gov.br City Hall's Official Website] * {{pt icon}} [http://www.seade.gov.br Fundação Sistema Estadual de Análise de Dados] has further demographic data for São Carlos. * {{pt icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20061006042531/http://www.aeronauticasc.eng.br/ Aeronautical Engineering Students Website] * {{pt icon}} [http://www.museuasasdeumsonho.com.br Official Web Site Aeronautical Museum] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{São Paulo state|São Carlos}} {{Municipalities of São Paulo}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sao Carlos}} [[Category:1857 establishments in Brazil]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1857]] [[Category:São Carlos| ]] [[Category:High-technology business districts]] [[Category:Science parks]]

{{advert|date=April 2018}} {{more citations needed|date=April 2018}} '''The Wing''' is a women's co-working space collective and club with offices in [[Manhattan]] and [[Brooklyn]], [[New York City]], [[Washington, D.C.]], and [[San Francisco]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.the-wing.com/|title=Our Spaces|work=The Wing|accessdate=15 October 2018}}</ref> It was founded by [[Audrey Gelman]] and [[Lauren Kassan]] in 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://uk.businessinsider.com/the-wing-women-only-coworking-space-photo-tour-2017-11|title=The exclusive no-men-allowed club that raised $32 million from investors like WeWork just opened a brand new location — take a look inside|newspaper=Business Insider|date=March 1, 2018|accessdate=April 12, 2018}}</ref> As of October 2018, the club has about 6,000 members.<ref>{{cite news |last1=McDowell |first1=Mahgen |title=Does SF need another co-working space? The women-first Wing founders are betting yes. |url=https://www.sfchronicle.com/style/article/Does-SF-need-another-co-working-space-The-13291635.php |publisher=San Francisco Chronicle |date=October 9, 2018}}</ref>
== Founders == === Audrey Gelman === Audrey Gelman, [[co-founder]] and [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] of The Wing, began her career working on [[Hillary Clinton]]'s 2008 presidential campaign. On the campaign, Gelman managed communications and ensured quick response from her team. Gelman also worked on the 2013 campaign of the New York City comptroller [[Scott Stringer]]. Most recently she worked in political and social affairs serving as [[Senior Vice-president|Senior Vice President]] at the strategic communications firm [[SKDKnickerbocker]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.linkedin.com/in/audrey-gelman-2782315|title=Audrey Gelman LinkedIn|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Gelman has been named one of [[Fast Company (magazine)|''Fast Company'']]'s "Most Creative People in Business", [[Forbes|''Forbes'' Magazine]]'s "30 under 30", one of the "50 Most Powerful Women in New York" by ''[[New York Daily News|The New York Daily News]]'', and one of ''[[BuzzFeed|Buzzfeed]]''{{'}}s "21 Amazing Role Models for Twentysomethings."
=== Lauren Kassan === Lauren Kassan received her Bachelor of Arts/Science from [[George Washington University|The George Washington University]] in Washington, D.C.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/lauren-kassan/#2a1a628345a8|title=Lauren Kassan|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-10-30|language=en}}</ref> After graduating, Kassan worked with fitness startups. She worked with now big name fitness startups such as SLT—a New York boutique fitness studio—where she eventually became the director of business development. Kassan also worked for [[ClassPass]] where she focused on the development of the startup's studio network. Kassan is well experienced in operations and community management and is the co-founder and [[Chief operating officer|COO]] of the women's co-working space, The Wing.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.fastcompany.com/person/lauren-kassan|title=Lauren Kassan, Most Creative People 2017 {{!}} Fast Company|work=Fast Company|access-date=2018-04-17|language=en-US}}</ref>
== History == The initial idea for The Wing stemmed from Gelman's personal desire for a space to change and relax between business meetings as she lived in Brooklyn, but worked in SoHo and Washington DC. The first title for this not-yet-created space was "Refresh".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/11/style/the-wing-womens-social-club-magazine.html|title=|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> When Kassan and Gelman began working together, they decided "The Wing" was a more fitting name, since it would represent a "wing" of the users' home away from their actual home. When developing this idea, the two decided to focus on creating a space where women can feel safe and supported.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/11/style/the-wing-womens-social-club-magazine.html|title=The Wing, a Chic Women's Club, Is Going Wide|last=Rosman|first=Katherine|date=2017-11-11|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-04-17|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
In October of 2016, Gelman and Kassan began The Wing's foundation in New York City's [[Flatiron District]], on the [[Ladies' Mile Historic District]]. They subsequently opened another branch in a loft in [[SoHo]]. The Wing opened a new space in April 2018 in [[Brooklyn]] in [[DUMBO]] neighborhood, and spaces in Washington D.C. and San Francisco in 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dezeen.com/2017/12/04/female-co-working-club-the-wing-new-york-soho-loft/|title=Female co-working club The Wing opens in New York loft|date=4 December 2017|website=dezeen.com|accessdate=30 April 2018}}</ref><ref name = Ford/>
The Washington, D.C., facility includes a booth dedicated to [[Anita Hill]]. The San Francisco space includes a conference room dedicated to [[Christine Blasey Ford]].<ref name = Ford>{{cite web|url=https://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/410616-womens-workspace-dedicates-new-conference-room-to-christine |title=Women's co-working network gives nod to Christine Blasey Ford at new space |publisher=TheHill |date=2018-10-09 |accessdate=2018-10-15}}</ref>
=== Human rights investigation === On March 1, 2018, the [[New York City Commission on Human Rights]] started a "commission-initiated" investigation<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2018/03/the-wing-discrimination-investigation-human-rights-commission.html|title=Women-Only Social Club Is Under Investigation by the NYC Human Rights Commission|last=Arnold|first=Amanda|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-04-17|language=en}}</ref> into how The Wing membership system operates. According to the application rules of the Wing, men cannot become members of The Wing or visit as guests. Nevertheless, the club says it will accept members who are "living as a woman" and will review applicants' social media to determine their identity. This requirement, however, may exclude people who are gender nonconforming or who do not identify on the gender binary, which became one of the reasons for the investigation to emerge, since New York prohibits discrimination on the basis of "[[gender identity]]" and "[[gender expression]]."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://slate.com/human-interest/2018/04/women-only-social-club-the-wing-is-violating-human-rights-law.html|title=Why the Wing, a Women-Only Social Club, Is Getting Away With Violating Human Rights Laws|last=Stern|first=Mark Joseph|work=Slate Magazine|access-date=2018-04-17|language=en}}</ref>
Representatives from The Wing planned a meeting to discuss the issues with NYCC, disputing the accuracy of the term "investigation." Instead, the company described the inquiry as a collaborative process. "All that's happened is that The Wing and the Commission have agreed, mutually, to sit down and have a conversation," said Karen Dunn of [[Boies, Schiller & Flexner|Boies Schiller Flexner]] LLP, who is representing the company in the matter. "We are looking forward to working with The Wing to ensure that they are in compliance with the law," said Seth Hoy, a spokesperson for the NYCC.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://jezebel.com/the-new-york-human-rights-commission-is-investigating-t-1823334726|title=The New York Human Rights Commission Is Investigating The Wing [Updated]|last=Trotter|first=J.K.|work=Jezebel|access-date=2018-04-17|language=en-US}}</ref>
The investigation evoked various disputes in the academic and social environments. Melissa Murray, a professor of law at [[University of California, Berkeley|U.C. Berkeley]] who is currently teaching at [[New York University]], criticized the commission's interest in The Wing: "I think it's patently absurd for New York's human rights commission to be focusing on The Wing when we've had, over the last six months, numerous complaints about workplaces being absolutely hostile to women in terms of pervasive and endemic sexual harassment." Craig Gurian, the executive director of the Anti-Discrimination Center in New York, however, offered a defense of New York City's public accommodations law: "To the extent that there are workplaces or public accommodations that have inappropriate behavior, the solution is to fix those workplaces or public accommodations. Separate is not equal. We were supposed to learn that a very long time ago.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://clubandresortbusiness.com/2018/04/wing-human-rights-law-investigation/|title="The Wing" Under Human Rights Law Investigation - Club & Resort Business|date=2018-04-04|work=Club & Resort Business|access-date=2018-04-17|language=en-US}}</ref>
New York City Commission on Human Rights [[Twitter|tweeted]] on March 27, 2018, responding to The Wing members' personal tweets defending their safe space: "In NYC, no one should be discriminated against or harassed because of their gender. @NYCCHR uses every resource at our disposal to hold violators accountable and get justice for victims. Last yr, we increased fines & damages collected by more than $1 mil, collecting $2.7 million."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://twitter.com/nycchr/status/978695116830408704|title=NYC Human Rights on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=2018-04-17|language=en}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2016}} {{Infobox person | name = Zbigniew Stonoga | image = Zbigniew Stonoga.jpg | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1974|10|17}} | birth_place = [[Ozimek]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Poland|Polish]] | other_names = | occupation = | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = | party = [[Congress of the New Right|KNP]] (2014)
[[Stonoga Partia Polska|SPP]] (2015) | website = http://zbigniewstonoga.eu/ }} '''Zbigniew Stonoga''' ({{IPA-pl|ˈzbiɡɲɛf stɔˈnɔɡa|pron}}; born 17 October 1974 in [[Ozimek]]){{cite news|title=Już się powygłupiałem, pokląłem. Tak wojuje Zbigniew Stonoga. SYLWETKA |url = http://wiadomosci.dziennik.pl/wydarzenia/artykuly/475076,zbigniew-stonoga-kontra-sokolowski-i-sld-wojny-zbigniewa-stonogi.html |accessdate = 18 June 2015| date = 9 June 2015}} is a Polish entrepreneur, known for the publication of the investigation files concerning the [[Wprost#Role in Polish bugging scandal|Polish bugging scandal (2014–2015)]], known as Waitergate and anti-government activity. In the wake of the publication of the files the reshuffles in the [[cabinet of Ewa Kopacz]] followed. Founder of Stonoga Party Poland. Notified to the register of political parties led by Section VII Civil Registration District Court in Warsaw.{{cite news| url = http://telewizjarepublika.pl/stonoga-partia-polska-rejestracja-nowej-formacji-politycznej-moze-nastapic-lada-dzien,20590.htm| title = "Stonoga Partia Polska. Rejestracja nowej formacji politycznej może nastąpić lada dzień". | date = 10 June 2015 | accessdate = 18 June 2015 }} The founder of Gazeta Stonoga. ==Biography == === Education and professional work === Electro-technical school graduate, studied, but did not finish, law at the University of Warsaw. == Lawsuits == In the 2000s Stonoga was accused in 89 lawsuits in 89 localities. In 2004 he was sentenced to 3.5 years imprisonment for financial irregularities. In 2005 his sentence was quashed but he spent additional 4 months in prison due to procedural errors. {{cite news|title=Już się powygłupiałem, pokląłem. Tak wojuje Zbigniew Stonoga. SYLWETKA |url = http://wiadomosci.dziennik.pl/wydarzenia/artykuly/475076,zbigniew-stonoga-kontra-sokolowski-i-sld-wojny-zbigniewa-stonogi.html |language=pl| accessdate = 18 June 2015| date = 9 June 2015}} By 2015, he was named in 61 criminal cases related mostly to financial fraud and insulting public servants; he was sentenced to a year in prison for fraud on a private car sale.{{cite news| url=http://www.polityka.pl/tygodnikpolityka/kraj/1623573,1,stonoga-raczej-do-wiezienia-niz-do-sejmu.read | title = Stonoga raczej do więzienia niż do Sejmu | language=pl}} == Political career == In 2015 he ran in Polish parliamentary elections in which his party, "Stonoga Party Poland", scored 0.4% (40 000 voters). After the results were announced, furious Stonoga uploaded a video to the internet in which he expressed his frustration with those who did not vote for him or for the [[Coalition for the Renewal of the Republic - Liberty and Hope]]{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qARYM_ACOk |title=Zbigniew Stonoga obraża Polaków: "WAS POLACZKI TYLKO DO AUSCHWITZ WYPROWADZIĆ" |publisher=YouTube |date=2015-08-31 |accessdate=2017-04-20}} His language is vulgar and direct, attracting the attention of the young audience. In 2015 he caught a pedophile in Cracow, with help from the police. His recordings of private conversations between Polish politicians have led to a few resignations. == References == {{Wikiquote|Zbigniew Stonoga}} {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stonoga, Zbigniew}} [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:Polish businesspeople]] [[Category:Polish activists]] [[Category:Polish politicians]] [[Category:Polish YouTubers]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Poland-business-bio-stub}}
